results.title: Rosies walk and 4 other stories
results.creator_credit: Morton Schindel, Cynthia Freitag, Gene Deitch and Weston Woods Studios
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Children’s circle”.
A compilation of 5 delightful and timeless children’s stories from around the world. Watch how Rosie the hen on her daily walk, outfoxes the wily fox in “Rosie’s walk” by Pat Hutchins. “The story of Ping” by Marjorie Flack, takes us to China on an adventure with Ping, the duck. Tomie de Paola’s “Charlie needs a cloak” shows how Charlie the shepherd makes his new winter cloak. H.A. Ray’s classic “Curious George rides a bicycle” has delighted readers of all ages while in “Norman the doorman” by Don Freeman, Norman the mouse harbours a secret ambition to be a great artist, while he stands on guard outside the mouse entrance of the Museum of Art.

results.title: Rosie's walk
results.creator_credit: Morton Schindel, Weston Woods Studios and Gene Deitch
results.brief_description: To the tune of “Turkey In The Straw”, the little red hen Rosie struts across the barnyard keeping her country cool, while unknowingly leading a stalking fox into one disaster after another. The spirited country music accompanying Pat Hutchins’ colourful illustrations make this suspenseful story a delightful fast-moving film.

results.title: Rosewood
results.creator_credit: Jon Peters, Warner Bros Pictures and John Singleton
results.brief_description: In 1982 a reporter doing a story about Levy County in Florida noticed the area seemed to have no black residents. The reporter asked questions, and details of a shocking, true tragedy decades earlier came to light. On New Year’s day, 1923, the town of Rosewood, populated by quiet, middle-class African-Americans was wiped off the face of the earth by angry whites from a neighboring community. Following the palpably false testimony by a single white woman against one “black” stranger, many of the men of Rosewood were hunted down and lynched, shot, or burned. The rest of the town’s residents fled into the swamps and never returned. The most notable black heroes are Sylvester (Don Cheadle), a music teacher and Mann (Ving Rhames), a stranger on horseback who becomes the focus of white hatred and black resistance. The adulterous town grocer John Wright (Jon Voight), one of the few white residents, also plays a key role in saving lives, but before he does, he must resolve painful racial issues and make a difficult personal choice. This film is based on a true story.

results.title: Roses are red
results.creator_credit: Robert Connolly, AFTRS and Marcella Hayward
results.brief_description: Two parking cops (Jacqueline McKenzie and Kris McQuade) journey into the night with the reality of their work weighing heavy whilst they dream of love. Enter Brian (David Wenham) who thinks it is even tougher being a flower seller and the last thing he needs is a parking ticket. This is a delightful comedy that evokes the banalities, difficulties and romance in everyday life.

results.title: Roses
results.brief_description: A woman who lives in a retirement home keeps returning back to the place where she moved out from to tend to the roses, and catch up with her next door neighbour. The flowers are the old woman’s only continuum between past and present, as she struggles to find a way to reclaim what was once hers in the garden that she nurtured when she was independent and self sufficient. Cast includes Martin Vaughn, Lois Ramsey, Lindy Sardelic and Liz Burch.

results.title: Rosemary Agostino in Italy; Angela Sarantis in Greece
results.creator_credit: David E. Barrow, Barinder Productions and Channel 0-28
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Through Australian eyes”.
Two programs from the series :Through Australian eyes”. In the first program Rosemary Agostino returns to her parents’ birthplace in Calabria. In the small village she becomes aware of the sense of community missing from life in Australia. In the second program Angela Sarantis returns to her father’s village in Kastraki in northern Greece. She sees that many changes have occurred since her parents left their homeland particularly due to the demands of Greece’s main industry, tourism.

results.title: Roseland
results.creator_credit: Beeldhuis, Ultima Vez, VRT, Audiovisuele Dienst K U Leuven and Alive From Off Center, Twin Cities Public Television, Walter Verdin, Wim Vandekeybus and Octavio Iturbe
results.brief_description: Ultima Vez is a dance company formed by director, choreographer, actor and photographer Wim Vandekeybus in 1985. This dance video, made from the material of Vandekeybus’ first three choreographies with the company, places these performances in the remarkable setting of a dilapidated Brussels cinema which had been abandoned for the past twenty years. Using a range of cinematic techniques, the film radiates a particular fascination of its own, transforming the theatrical energy of the stage choreography into a dynamic screen experience. For more information go to http://www.ultimavez.com/

results.title: Rose and rose gardens
results.creator_credit: Stuart Crowner, Bruce Franchini and KCET (Television station : Los Angeles, Calif.)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Gardens of the world”.
Host Audrey Hepburn, leads a glorious adventure with the rose, the world’s most popular flower. Starting with the French ideal of a rose garden at La Roseraie de l’Hays les Roses, to the magic of the unsurpassed collection of old roses at Montisfont Abbey in Hampshire, England, the rose claims its rightful place as the ultimate flower of legend, romance and beauty. Special guest appearance by world renown author and rosarian, Graham Stuart Thomas.

results.title: Rose against the odds
results.creator_credit: Onset Productions, Ross Close, Russell Kennedy and John Dixon
results.brief_description: The fate of Australia’s most prominent Aboriginal boxer, Lionel Rose, is charted here in dramatic detail and enacted by Paul Williams. Roses’ career culminated in 1968 when the then unknown 19 year old became world bantamweight champion. His success made him a household name and national hero with people from all walks of life. It was not a path paved in gold however, as battles with alcohol would mar his ultimately triumphant life. Cast also includes Telly Savalas, Tsurutaro, Kris McQuade, Tony Barry, Vicki Blanche and Steve Jacobs.
